intro: Scabiosa hybrida, commonly known as the sweet William, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caprifoliaceae family. It is characterized by its clusters of small, rounded flowers that range in color from pink to white and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 12 to 30 inches and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Scabiosa hybrida is native to Europe and is often cultivated for its beauty and ability to attract pollinators.
